definition: Global Times (weekly digest of international news from People's Daily 人民日報|人民日报[Ren2 min2 Ri4 bao4])
ring/hoop/loop/(chain) link/classifier for scores in archery etc/to surround/to encircle/to hem in

sentences.english: I write op-eds for GT's English edition (and China Daily).
sentences.chinese: 我给《环球时报》的英文版以及中国日报的专栏写稿。

sentences.english: Cheng Gang, a journalist with the Global Times, is also slated to participate.
sentences.chinese: 中国《环球时报》记者陈刚也将出席活动。

sentences.english: The Global Times, a tabloid owned by the Communist Party's People's Daily newspaper, hit hard upon the theme of besiegement.
sentences.chinese: 人民日报下属媒体《环球时报》对美国围攻反映激烈。

sentences.english: The state-run Global Times newspaper early this week reported a dense 'fog' had descended over the capital.
sentences.chinese: 《环球时报》上周初报道说，首都北京降下大“雾”。

sentences.english: The Global Times article also pointed to criticism of a cross-dressing comedian, Xiao Shenyang.
sentences.chinese: 《环球时报》的文章也对小沈阳的二人转提出了批评。

definition: Newsweek magazine/also written 新聞周刊|新闻周刊
South China Morning Post (newspaper in Hong Kong)
Donald Trump (1946-), American business magnate, US president 2017-
abbr. for 朝鮮中央通訊社|朝鲜中央通讯社[Chao2 xian3 Zhong1 yang1 Tong1 xun4 she4]
editorial (in a newspaper)/also written 社論|社论
Mike Pence (1959-), US Republican politician, US vice president from 2017
